name: Belém Tower
description: Riverside fortress and symbol of Portugal’s Age of Discovery

name: Jerónimos Monastery
description: UNESCO-listed monastery showcasing Manueline architecture

name: São Jorge Castle
description: Hilltop Moorish citadel with panoramic city views

name: Praça do Comércio
description: Grand riverside square once the gateway to the city

name: Santa Justa Elevator
description: Neo-Gothic lift connecting Baixa and Bairro Alto

name: Tram 28
description: Historic streetcar winding through Lisbon’s oldest quarters

name: Alfama District
description: Labyrinthine quarter famed for Fado, viewpoints, and tiled façades

name: Bairro Alto
description: Bohemian hilltop area known for nightlife and street art

name: Chiado
description: Elegant shopping and café district between Baixa and Bairro Alto

name: LX Factory
description: Creative hub of shops, galleries, and restaurants in a former factory complex

name: Time Out Market (Mercado da Ribeira)
description: Gourmet food hall featuring top Portuguese chefs

name: Feira da Ladra
description: Weekly flea market selling antiques, textiles, and trinkets

name: Calouste Gulbenkian Museum
description: Diverse art collection from antiquity to modern times

name: National Tile Museum
description: Stunning display of azulejos in a former convent

name: MAAT – Museum of Art, Architecture and Technology
description: Cutting-edge exhibitions in a riverside modernist building

name: Berardo Collection Museum
description: World-class modern and contemporary art in Belém Cultural Center

name: Oceanário de Lisboa
description: Europe’s largest indoor aquarium in Parque das Nações

name: Parque das Nações
description: Modern riverside district with gardens, cable car, and promenade

name: Eduardo VII Park
description: Formal gardens atop a hill overlooking the city

name: Miradouro da Senhora do Monte
description: One of Lisbon’s highest viewpoints with 360° panorama

name: Miradouro de Santa Luzia
description: Charming terrace with azulejo panels and river views

name: Miradouro de São Pedro de Alcântara
description: Landscaped belvedere overlooking downtown Lisbon

name: Convento do Carmo
description: Gothic church ruins, a haunting reminder of the 1755 earthquake

name: Carmo Archaeological Museum
description: Open-air museum set within the roofless Carmo Convent

name: Fado Dinner Show
description: Authentic evening of Portuguese music paired with traditional cuisine

name: Pastel de Nata Workshop
description: Hands-on class to master Lisbon’s famous custard tart

name: Tile Painting Workshop
description: Learn to decorate your own azulejo panel

name: Sunset Tagus River Cruise
description: Scenic boat trip to admire Lisbon’s waterfront at dusk

name: Cristo Rei Sanctuary
description: Statue and overlook across the river with sweeping city vistas

name: Sintra Day Trip
description: Explore whimsical palaces and gardens of Sintra UNESCO site

name: Cascais Day Trip
description: Coastal resort town with beaches and seafood restaurants

name: Vasco da Gama Bridge Viewpoint
description: Modern bridge spanning the Tagus, visible from Parque das Nações

name: Mouraria Street Art
description: Vibrant murals in Lisbon’s traditional Moorish quarter

name: LX Factory Street Art Tour
description: Guided walk to discover urban art in the creative district

name: Berlengas Island Excursion
description: Boat trip to a nature reserve archipelago west of Lisbon

name: Park Bar
description: Rooftop cocktail bar atop a multi-story car park

name: Musicbox Club
description: Underground venue for live music and DJs in Cais do Sodré

name: Topo Rooftop Bar
description: Trendy rooftop with Alcântara and Castle views

name: Pink Street (Rua Nova do Carvalho)
description: Colorful nightlife strip along the riverfront

name: Immersive Escape Game
description: Themed puzzle rooms inspired by Lisbon’s history
